intro: Biophytum candolleanum, commonly known as the candolleanum or the silver leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in arid regions.
